quest.name: House of Divinities
journal: Judging by his furrowed brow, something important has occurred to Estinien.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Helping a struggling fisherman you've only just met to peddle his catch... Yes, you would do something like that.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayhap owing to the island's small size, the tower's impact upon the people's lives doth appear more pronounced here than in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: That Matsya fellow you were helping─he's Arkasodara, is he not?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Apparently, 'tis almost exclusively his people that are being kidnapped. Should he be traveling alone?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If summoning is this perpetrator's aim, it doth stand to reason that Arkasodara would be their primary targets.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For 'tis the faith of their ancestors which prevaileth in this land, and many are devout adherents still.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We'd better go after him. Akyaali lies to the west, as I recall─the same direction as Krile's acquaintance, incidentally.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It's settled, then. Keep your eyes peeled while we make for the village.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You do not see Matsya nearby, but the elevated ground up ahead may provide a better vantage point...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You do not see Matsya from here either...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: (-???-)N-No! Leave me alone! Help! Somebody, help!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Matsya's voice─and it came from the north!

dialogue.name: BALLON
dialogue.text: Fuel... Gather fuel...

dialogue.name: BALLON
dialogue.text: Meddlers... Eliminate...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: H-Huh? Where did they go? Why are you here...?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see you found him in time.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Y-You and your friends came to look for me? I don't know how to thank you...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: On my way home, I took a moment to stop and rest. Think about what to do about, well...everything.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: And then those men came...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Kidnappers. We'd heard that the Arkasodara were being targeted.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Surely you have as well? Perhaps it's best if you took refuge in the city.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: We've considered it, me and the others. But fishing is all we know─the ocean all we have.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see... That's your decision to make, but you should take care not to travel alone.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A question, if I may.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis our understanding that strange fiends have emerged from the tower. What canst thou tell us of these beings?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Not much, I'm afraid. I have no idea what they are.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: But I've heard that some bear an unsettling resemblance to our divinities.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: For that reason, some have taken to calling the tower “Zot”...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: "House of divinities“ in the old tongue, it means.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: But they're not true divinities. They're monstrous imitations that bring only death!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To have one's faith so twisted is a grievous indignity, and full justified art thou in thine outrage.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Know that 'tis for no other purpose but to neutralize the tower that we have journeyed to this land.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In time we may be forced to contend with these false gods, and thus we would learn all we may about them. Wilt thou not tell us of thy divinities and their true nature?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: You've come all this way to save us...? Really!? To think I had you peddling fish...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: But to answer your question─yes, of course! We would gladly tell you about our gods. “We,” I say, because I'm a terrible storyteller, and I'd ask my fellow villagers to do it.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: So please come to our village. We're good, gods-fearing folk, all of us, and we'd be honored to share our knowledge. And fish!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What sayest thou? Shall we pay visit to Akyaali?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Wonderful! Just follow the road west and down the hill─you can't miss it!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: So, 'tis the simulacra of Thavnairian gods that are being summoned... If any doubt existed before, there can be none now: the kidnapped Hannish are imprisoned in the tower.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I pray that we will be able to save them...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Though indeed, saving them will mean confronting their false gods, like as not. Aye, as you said, we'd do well to study their religious traditions. To Akyaali.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A charming little village. Shame about the hideous tower.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Familiar though I am with the myths and legends of this island, to hear them spoken by heirs to this storied heritage giveth them new life.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Mark you that platform out on the water. Some manner of shrine, perhaps?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Welcome to Akyaali, my friend! The name means “white beach,” and there isn't much here save that...but please make yourself at home.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Your companions have already begun talking to everyone. Feel free to show yourself around and do the same.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Any one of us can tell you about our gods, but you could do worse than to start with Khanga and old Hasveydah. They're free at the moment, as it happens.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: I'll try to think if there is anything useful I can share with you as well. After all, I still owe you for rescuing me on the hill!

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: Hm? You wish to know about our gods? What a curious visitor you are. Most want fish. In any case, I'm happy to oblige.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: Now, I don't know how it is whence you hail, but our isle is home to many gods.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: They can be divided into two groups: the Manusya, beings of wisdom who assume the form of men; and the Mrga, beings of might who assume the form of beasts.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: Together They are divinities─Their forms and personalities many and varied.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: Some are kind and gentle, others stern and temperamental─just like we mortals can be.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: All are possessed of great insight and experience, and by heeding Their teachings, we strive to be better people and live better lives.

dialogue.name: KHANGA
dialogue.text: Different though They may be, both the Manusya and the Mrga are equally divine and equally revered.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: Interested in learning about our gods, you say? Heh, that's what I like to hear! Prick up your ears, then, and listen.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: In ancient times, the Manusya and the Mrga─deities who look like men and beasts, respectively─were locked in conflict.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: Eventually, seeking the wisdom of the Manusya, the Mrga cast aside Their own heads and took up those of Their foes.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: Likewise, the Manusya coveted the might of the Mrga, and so They too resolved to trade heads.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: Thus were born new gods possessed of both might and wisdom, and They ushered in an age of harmony between the two factions.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: From then on, as a sign of Their esteem for one another, the Manusya have worn animal faces, and the Mrga the limbs of men.

dialogue.name: HASVEYDAH
dialogue.text: We honor the Manusya and the Mrga by incorporating Their sacred images into works both practical and artistic. Try looking out for them, eh?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: There you are. Learned a thing or two about our gods, I trust?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: While you were off talking to the others, I remembered something that may be of interest.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: If you could let your friends know, I'll go and fetch it from my home at once.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Apologies for the wait. I wished to show you this hanging scroll which depicts three of our most revered deities.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: By all means, we should like to see it.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: They are Manusya─you heard about Them already, yes? Three sisters.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: The center one is the eldest. Cinduruva, a goddess of wisdom. For this, alchemists hold Her in the highest.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: To Her right is the middle sister, Sanduruva. As a goddess of wealth, She counts many traders among Her followers.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: And on the left is Minduruva, the youngest sibling. She presides over the crafts, and so is beloved by weavers.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Although each is worshipped for different reasons, the sisters are usually portrayed together in these works, which people keep in their homes for good fortune.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In like fashion to the Manusya, the deities of Eorzea preside over myriad aspects of life. And what of the Mrga, if I may ask?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: The Mrga hold power over nature. In ages past, They were revered as guardian deities in times of conflict.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: If you have occasion to visit our temples and ruins, you'll find Their images there.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Among them is a god who possesses a gaja's head, and He is venerated as the progenitor of the Arkasodara.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: And then there are dragons. They occupy a special place in our history.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You worship dragons too?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: It's said that an ancestor of the satrap─that's the ruler of Radz-at-Han─forged a covenant with a dragon divinity in ancient times.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: This divinity has since acted as the guardian deity of the satrap. Legend holds that, if ever the satrap is in need, his dragon ally will fly to his aid!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Dragon ally...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You claimed to be a terrible storyteller, but nothing could be further from the truth.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The passion you bear for your faith is plain to hear. I am confident that the information you've given us will serve us well in our efforts to deal with the tower.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: That is very kind of you to say. Thank you! I will pray for your success.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Right, I believe it's time we sought out Krile's acquaintance.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: An alchemist by the name of Nidhana.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: According to Krile's notes, we're to find her at a place called the Great Work, further north along the coast.
